body_html: Nice investigation! Bazel's select brings back some memories....we spent time debugging why we couldn't package our custom GPU ops as a Bazel project that depends on TensorFlow as a submodule....turned it out that Bazel's select is not sensitive to workspace it's defined in, and custom_op/cuda had a bunch of those.
body_text: Nice investigation! Bazel's select brings back some memories....we spent time debugging why we couldn't package our custom GPU ops as a Bazel project that depends on TensorFlow as a submodule....turned it out that Bazel's select is not sensitive to workspace it's defined in, and custom_op/cuda had a bunch of those.
body: Nice investigation! Bazel's select brings back some memories....we spent time debugging why we couldn't package our custom GPU ops as a Bazel project that depends on TensorFlow as a submodule....turned it out that Bazel's select is [not sensitive](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41153199/building-a-tensorflow-based-android-app-with-tensorflow-as-a-repository) to workspace it's defined in, and custom_op/cuda had a bunch of those.
